question: 買い物
sourceMnemonic: You've hopefully seen <ja>買う</ja> by now and know it means "to buy." So, <ja>買い</ja> is going to be similar to that. Add that to <kanji>thing</kanji> and you have a "buying things" sort of word. What does "buying things" describe? It describes <vocabulary>shopping</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings are the kun'yomi, which is usually the case when there's hiragana in the middle. You learned the reading for <ja>買い</ja> when you learned the kanji, as well as the word <ja>買う</ja>, and you learned this reading of <ja>物</ja> in the word <ja>物</ja>!
